Chapter on the Inconceivable Dharma of the Buddha
At that time, among the great assembly of bodhisattvas, there were bodhisattvas who had the following thought:

The buddha-lands are inconceivable, the pure vows of the buddhas are inconceivable, the lineage of the buddhas is inconceivable, the appearance in the world of the buddhas is inconceivable, the dharma-body of the buddhas is inconceivable, the voice of the buddhas is inconceivable, the wisdom of the buddhas is inconceivable, the spiritual powers and mastery of the buddhas are inconceivable, the unobstructed abiding of the buddhas is inconceivable, the liberation of the buddhas is inconceivable.
At that time, the World-Honored One, knowing the thoughts in the minds of the bodhisattvas, then bestowed upon the Bodhisattva of Blue Lotus Flowers:

The Buddha's spiritual powers, wisdom, eloquence, merits, and fearlessness filled his body, and he perfected all the Buddha's Dharma realms and the Buddha's spiritual powers and realms without obstructed practices. He distinguished the lineage of all TathÄgatas and had innumerable skillful means of the Buddhas.

At that time, Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva Blue Lotus Flower immediately entered the profound unobstructed Dharma realm and cultivated bodhisattva practices in all unobstructed dharmas, accomplishing the vows of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva. He followed all Buddhas and adorned himself with great adornments. With great compassion, he universally observed all sentient beings, wishing to purify them;

in a single thought, he gave rise to the TathÄgata's immeasurable great wisdom, accomplished the TathÄgata's inexhaustible Dharma door of wisdom, and accomplished all dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s. The light of eloquence universally illuminated all.
At that time, Bodhisattva Blue Lotus Flower, empowered by the Buddha's spiritual power, addressed Bodhisattva Lotus Treasury, saying:
Buddha's disciple!

The buddhas have innumerable pure and wondrous abodes, the buddhas dwell in innumerable sovereign freedoms, the buddhas never miss the right time for anything, all buddhas equally turn the pure Dharma wheel, the buddhas' four unobstructed eloquences are inexhaustible, all buddha-dharmas are inconceivable, the pure sounds of all buddhas reach everywhere, all buddhas can discern the innumerable Dharma realms, the light of all buddhas universally illuminates, and the teachings of all buddhas all enter the profound Dharma realm.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of Dharma realms that are immeasurable and boundless.
What are the ten?
The physical bodies of all buddhas are pure and immeasurable, surpassing the world;
The unobstructed eyes of all buddhas are immeasurable and boundless, equally awakening to all dharmas with purity;
All buddhas have unobstructed ears, immeasurable and boundless, discerning the sounds of all sentient beings;
All buddhas have immeasurable and boundless entrances to the nose, pure and ultimate, all buddhas attaining the other shore of mastery;
All buddhas have immeasurable and boundless broad and long tongues, emitting wonderful sounds heard throughout the Dharma realm;
All buddhas have immeasurable and boundless physical actions, manifesting the TathÄgata's body in accordance with sentient beings;
All buddhas have immeasurable and boundless mental actions, unobstructed throughout the three times, with the pure Dharma body indestructible;
All buddhas have immeasurable and boundless Dharma gates of unobstructed liberation, manifesting inexhaustible spiritual powers and mastery;
All buddhas have immeasurable and boundless adornments of buddha lands in all worlds, in accordance with sentient beings;

All buddhas are immeasurable and boundless, and the practices and excellent vows of bodhisattvas and their mastery of spiritual powers are all fulfilled, and they are all able to awaken to the true Dharma of the buddhas.
Buddha's disciple!
These are the ten kinds of Dharma realms of all buddhas, which are immeasurable and boundless.
Buddha's disciple!
All buddhas, in every single thought, are able to give rise to ten inexhaustible wisdoms.
What are the ten?
In a single thought, they manifest all worlds descending from Tuá¹£ita Heaven to end their life;ğŸ”½in a single thought, they manifest all worlds with the birth of bodhisattvas;
in a single thought, they manifest all worlds with the renunciation of bodhisattvas;
in a single thought, they manifest all worlds going to the site of enlightenment, to the foot of the bodhi tree, and attaining perfect enlightenment;
in a single thought, they manifest all worlds turning the pure Dharma wheel;
In a single thought, they manifest all worlds and guide and liberate all sentient beings as appropriate;
In a single thought, they manifest adorned bodies in all worlds, in accordance with sentient beings;
In a single thought, they manifest various adornments and innumerable adornments in all worlds, the self-mastery and treasury of omniscience of the TathÄgatas;
In a single thought, they manifest all worlds with pure sentient beings;
In a single thought, they pervade all worlds and manifest the buddhas of the three times;

In a single thought, in order to manifest the lineage of buddhas of the three times and attain perfect enlightenment, they guide sentient beings according to their various faculties, diligence, and aspirations.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of knowledge that all buddhas generate in a single thought.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of times that are never missed.
What are the ten?
All buddhas attain perfect enlightenment without ever missing the right time;
All buddhas' roots of goodness and karmic rewards are never untimely;
All buddhas confer predictions on bodhisattvas without ever missing the right time;
All buddhas manifest spiritual powers in accord with sentient beings without ever missing the right time;
All buddhas manifest the TathÄgata's body without ever missing the right time;
All buddhas practice equanimity without ever missing the right time;
All buddhas enter cities and villages without ever missing the right time;
All buddhas embrace and delight sentient beings without ever missing the right time;
All buddhas abandon those sentient beings who are difficult to transform, in order to tame them, without ever missing the right time;
All buddhas manifest inconceivable spiritual powers without ever missing the right time.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten things of all buddhas that are never untimely.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of inconceivable realms that cannot be compared to anything.
What are the ten?
Sitting cross-legged, they pervade all worlds in the ten directions;
With a single utterance, they are able to expound all buddha-dharmas;
Emitting a single light, they are able to illuminate all worlds;
With a single body, they are able to manifest all bodies;
Without leaving their original place, they are able to manifest all worlds;
Determining a single dharma, they are unobstructed by any dharma;
In a single thought, they are able to fill all worlds without remainder;
In a single thought, they are able to manifest the merits of all buddhas;
In a single thought, they are able to manifest all buddhas of the three times;
Teaching and transforming all sentient beings without abandoning the buddhas' samÄdhi of quiescence and non-duality.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten inconceivable realms of all buddhas that cannot be compared to anything.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of wisdom of birth and support.
What are the ten?
All dharmas have no destination yet can give rise to the wisdom of pure vows;
All dharmas have no body yet can give rise to the wisdom of the Dharma body;
All dharmas are completely non-dual yet give rise to the realization of all dharmas;
All dharmas are completely without self and sentient beings yet can give rise to the wisdom of transforming sentient beings;
All dharmas are completely without characteristics yet can give rise to the wisdom of various characteristics;
All worlds are completely without formation and destruction yet can give rise to the wisdom of the formation and destruction of the world;
All dharmas have no creator yet can give rise to the wisdom of karmic retribution;
All dharmas are inexpressible yet can give rise to the wisdom of speaking the Dharma realm;
All dharmas are without defilement and purity yet can give rise to the wisdom of defilement and purity;
All dharmas are without arising and ceasing, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom of dependent origination.
Buddha's disciple!
These are the ten kinds of wisdom of arising and upholding of all Buddhas.
Buddha's disciple!
All Buddhas have ten kinds of immeasurable inner dharmas.
What are the ten?
All Buddhas have pure inner bodies that accord with the three times;
All Buddhas have the three inner Dharma wheels to teach and transform sentient beings;
All Buddhas have the inner profound wisdom dhÄraá¹‡Ä« to distinguish all Buddha Dharmas;
All Buddhas have the inner four unobstructed abilities and the Dharma wheel, turning the pure Dharma wheel among the four assemblies;
All Buddhas have the inner great kindness and great compassion, able to not abandon all sentient beings;
All Buddhas always abide in inner tranquil concentration, observing sentient beings without ever missing the right time;
All Buddhas have the inner skillful and wonderful roots of goodness to tame sentient beings;
All buddhas have within them the abode of all Dharma realms, the abode of non-obstruction;
All buddhas, in a single thought, are able to manifest all buddhas of the three times appearing in the world;
All buddhas within have the discrimination of all the incalculable eons of the three times being just one day.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of immeasurable inner dharmas of all buddhas.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of extremely profound great dharmas.
What are the ten?
All buddhas are able to destroy all mÄras;
All buddhas are able to subdue all non-Buddhists;
All buddhas are able to transform and liberate all sentient beings, causing them to rejoice;
All buddhas are able to go to all worlds to teach and transform sentient beings;
All buddhas are able to discern and know the extremely profound Dharma realm;
All buddhas, with various bodies, pervade all worlds, yet without different bodies;
All buddhas, with each sound, are endowed with the four kinds of eloquence, never ceasing;
All buddhas, those who see them, all cause them to rejoice, benefiting without falsehood;

All buddhas, with each pore, in sequence give rise to the dust motes of all worlds, equal to the buddhas, never ceasing. All buddhas, in each dust mote, manifest the dust motes of all worlds, with the adornments of various buddha lands, always turning the wheel of the Dharma, teaching and transforming beings, never ceasing. Yet the dust motes are not large, and the worlds are not small. They decisively understand and abide in the Dharma realm;
All buddhas, in all dharmas, awaken to the darkness and are endowed with the ten powers. They extensively explain the true Dharma for all beings, eliminating the darkness of delusion.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of profound great dharmas of all buddhas.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of merits of purity free from evil.
What are the ten?
All buddhas originally cultivate all merits and are pure free from evil;
All buddhas are born in the family of the tathÄgatas of the three times and are pure free from evil;
All buddhas have no attachment in the future and are pure free from evil;
All buddhas are not attached to the dharmas of the three times and are pure free from evil;
All buddhas are free from various false thoughts and adorn themselves with a single adornment and are pure free from evil;
All buddhas' merits are inexhaustible, abiding in the Dharma realm and equal, and are pure free from evil;

All buddhas' physical bodies are pure and wondrous, immeasurable and boundless, universally manifesting in all worlds in the ten directions, teaching and transforming beings without ever missing the right time and are pure free from evil;

All buddhas abide in the four fearlessnesses, free from all fear, and in the midst of the assemblies of all devas and humans they roar the great lion's roar, extensively expounding the teachings to delight the assembly and free them from evil and purify them;

The buddhas who have entered parinirvÄá¹‡a in inexpressibly inexpressible eons, if there are sentient beings who hear their names, they will attain great rewards, just as if the buddhas were presently here, free from evil and pure;

All buddhas dwell far away in inexpressibly inexpressible worlds, and if there are sentient beings who single-mindedly and correctly contemplate them, those tathÄgatas will immediately appear before them, free from evil and pure.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of merits of all buddhas, free from evil and pure.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of ultimate purity.
What are the ten?

All Buddhas have perfected pure vows, all Buddhas have perfected pure conduct and precepts, all Buddhas have perfected the abandonment of all attachments, all Buddhas have perfected pure Buddha lands, all Buddhas have perfected pure retinues, all Buddhas have perfected pure lineages, all Buddhas have perfected pure physical bodies and characteristics, all Buddhas have perfected the Dharma body, all Buddhas have perfected the unobstructed body of omniscience, and all Buddhas have perfected liberation, having accomplished what was to be done and forever reached the other shore.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of ultimate purity of all Buddhas.
Buddha's disciples!
All Buddhas have ten kinds of Buddha activities in all worlds at all times.
What are the ten?
All buddhas, if there are sentient beings who correctly contemplate them, will appear before them;
All buddhas always expound the MahÄyÄna for the sake of sentient beings;
All buddhas are always able to nurture the immeasurable wholesome roots of all sentient beings;
All buddhas, if there are sentient beings who have just transcended birth and death and entered the stage of correct Dharma, they all discern and know them;
All buddhas do not abandon the assemblies of sentient beings to be taught and transformed;
All buddhas always travel to all worlds without obstruction;
All buddhas' great compassion is always inseparable from all sentient beings;
All buddhas' transformed bodies are always uninterrupted;
All buddhas' sovereign spiritual powers are never interrupted;
All buddhas always abide in the pure Dharma realm and extensively expound it for the sake of sentient beings.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of buddha activities of all buddhas in all worlds and at all times.
Buddha-Son!
All Buddhas have ten kinds of inexhaustible skillful means and wisdom oceans.
What are the ten?
All Buddhas' Dharma bodies are inexhaustible wisdom oceans;
All Buddhas' merits are inexhaustible wisdom oceans;
All Buddhas' eye of wisdom's realm is inexhaustible wisdom oceans;
All Buddhas' inconceivable roots of goodness are inexhaustible wisdom oceans;
All Buddhas' practices of all dharmas are inexhaustible wisdom oceans;
All Buddhas' rain of sweet dew Dharma is inexhaustible wisdom oceans;
All Buddhas' praise of the Buddhas' merits are inexhaustible wisdom oceans;
All Buddhas' original vows and practices are inexhaustible wisdom oceans;
All Buddhas, until the end of the future, always perform Buddha's work for all sentient beings without ever resting, with inexhaustible wisdom oceans;
The wisdom ocean of all buddhas knowing the mental activities of sentient beings without end;
The wisdom ocean of all buddhas giving rise to the merits of omniscience without end.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of wisdom oceans of skillful means of all buddhas without end.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of constant dharmas.
What are the ten?

All buddhas always practice all perfections; all buddhas are always free from delusion regarding all dharmas; all buddhas always possess great compassion; all buddhas always possess immeasurable powers; all buddhas always turn the unsurpassed Dharma wheel; all buddhas always liberate all sentient beings; all buddhas always manifest perfect enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings; all buddhas always respond to and transform all sentient beings; all buddhas always practice right mindfulness and the non-dual Dharma; all buddhas always manifest nirvÄá¹‡a after transforming sentient beings. The realm of the buddhas is boundless.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten constant dharmas of all buddhas.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of immeasurable explanations of the Buddha Dharma.
What are the ten?
All buddhas explain the immeasurable realm of sentient beings;
All buddhas expound the various practices of innumerable sentient beings;
All buddhas expound the various karmic retributions of innumerable sentient beings;
All buddhas expound the various means of liberating innumerable sentient beings;
All buddhas have the various means of purifying the practices of innumerable sentient beings;
All buddhas have the various means of teaching and transforming all bodhisattvas and establishing the practices of bodhisattvas;
All buddhas expound the various sublime vows of innumerable bodhisattvas;
All buddhas expound the various means of the formation and destruction of innumerable worlds;
All buddhas expound the various means of the pure buddha lands of innumerable sentient beings, the correct aspirations of all bodhisattvas;

All buddhas expound the various means of the wisdom of the buddhas, the successive appearance of the buddhas of the past, present, and future in the innumerable worlds, and the good discrimination of this.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of immeasurable explanations of the Buddha's teachings by all Buddhas.
Buddha's disciples!
All Buddhas have ten kinds of dharmas, always acting as Buddhas for sentient beings.
What are the ten?
The physical bodies of all Buddhas always act as Buddhas for sentient beings;ğŸ”½The sounds of all Buddhas always act as Buddhas for sentient beings;
The acceptance of offerings by all Buddhas always acts as a Buddha for sentient beings;
The non-acceptance of offerings by all Buddhas always acts as a Buddha for sentient beings;
All Buddhas always use earth, water, fire, and wind to act as Buddhas;
The realm of the spiritual powers and upholding of all Buddhas always acts as a Buddha for sentient beings;
All Buddhas always use their names to act as Buddhas for sentient beings;
All Buddhas always use the realm of their Buddha lands to universally act as Buddhas for sentient beings;
All buddhas always use their pure buddha lands to perform buddha deeds for sentient beings;
All buddhas always use silence to perform buddha deeds for sentient beings.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten dharmas of all buddhas, which they always perform as buddha deeds for sentient beings.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of dharmas of steadfast men.
What are the ten?
All buddhas' vows are steadfast and indestructible, practicing as they speak, their words and actions corresponding;
All buddhas cultivate bodhisattva practices for the entire future, their meritorious adornments never fearful;
All buddhas, in order to transform all sentient beings, go to innumerable worlds, and in all worlds they teach sentient beings without obstruction;
All buddhas equally contemplate with great compassion those sentient beings who have faith and those who do not, regarding them as no different;
All buddhas, from their initial aspiration for enlightenment until they attain perfect enlightenment, never regress from the aspiration for enlightenment;
All buddhas cultivate all meritorious virtues, all of which they dedicate to omniscience, not seeking worldly practices;

All buddhas, in the presence of all buddhas, practice in accordance with the actions of body, speech, and mind, forever abandoning the minds of Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas, single-mindedly seeking unsurpassed enlightenment. The meritorious virtues they cultivate they all dedicate to omniscience, seeking the unsurpassed path and attaining perfect enlightenment;
All buddhas universally illuminate the immeasurable and boundless true Dharma of all buddhas, purifying the bodhisattva mind and ultimately perfecting omniscience;

All buddhas are able to abandon all worldly pleasures, not delighting in the worldly things that are wished for and enjoyed, not attached to the world, causing all sentient beings to extinguish all suffering and attain the equal bliss of quiescence;

All buddhas, for the sake of all sentient beings, undergo immeasurable suffering, all wishing to establish the buddha lineage, causing all sentient beings to happily seek enlightenment, transcend birth and death, and attain the stage of the ten powers.
Buddha's disciple!
These are the ten dharmas of all buddhas as steadfast heroes.
Buddha's disciple!
All buddhas have ten kinds of unobstructed abodes of buddhas.
What are the ten?
All buddhas can travel to all worlds without obstruction;
all buddhas can dwell in all worlds without obstruction;
all buddhas walk, stand, sit, and lie down in all worlds without obstruction;
all buddhas expound the Dharma in all worlds without obstruction;
all buddhas dwell in the Tuá¹£ita Heaven in all worlds without obstruction;
All buddhas abide in the Dharma realm of the three times without obstruction;
All buddhas abide in the Dharma realm, their retinues filling it, expounding the Dharma without obstruction;
All buddhas in a single thought know the mental activities of all sentient beings and tame them with the three wheels of teaching without obstruction;
All buddhas are able to abide in all buddhas' inconceivable Dharma gates with a single body without obstruction;
All buddhas are able to distinguish all sentient beings without obstruction;
All buddhas are able to distinguish all tathÄgatas without obstruction.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of unobstructed abodes of all buddhas.
Buddha's disciples!
All buddhas have ten kinds of supreme, unsurpassed adornments.
What are the ten?
All buddhas have physical bodies with supreme and unsurpassed adornments of excellent characteristics and marks, which is the supreme and unsurpassed physical adornment of all buddhas.

All buddhas have eight kinds of subtle sounds, and each sound has five hundred subtle sounds as its retinue. Innumerable hundreds of thousands of sounds adorn them. The techniques of immeasurable and boundless subtle sounds are all pure. They are able to universally expound the meaning and flavor of the true Dharma of all buddhas. They are all free from fear and dwell in the fearless great lion's roar. They cause all sentient beings in the Dharma realm to hear their sounds according to their past wholesome roots, and cause them all to be enlightened. This is the supreme and unsurpassed adornment of the speech karma of all buddhas.

All buddhas are adorned with the ten powers of the mind, opening the great samÄdhi flowers of the buddhas, with the eighteen distinctive abilities adorning their sphere of activity without obstruction, abiding in the stage of the Dharma realm, attaining the source and bottom of all the buddhas' teachings, adorning the entire Dharma realm without remainder, in a single thought moment discerning and knowing all the Dharma realms and the mental activities of all sentient beings of the three times without exception. This is the supreme and unsurpassed adornment of the mental activity of all buddhas.

All buddhas are endowed with the supreme and unsurpassed adornment of light, universally emitting the treasury of great light, each light having innumerable wondrous nets of light as its retinue, universally illuminating the worlds of the buddhas of the ten directions, eliminating all the darkness of the world, manifesting the appearance of the buddhas in the world performing the supreme buddha-work that is irreversible, giving rise to the immeasurable pure Dharma body. This is the supreme and unsurpassed adornment of light of all buddhas.

When all buddhas smile, they emit from their mouths innumerable, incalculable, koá¹­i nayuta lights, each with various, immeasurable, inconceivable colors, universally illuminating all worlds in the ten directions, bestowing predictions of anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi on innumerable, incalculable sentient beings. This is the most supreme and unsurpassed universal illumination, the adornment of manifesting freedom from delusion of all buddhas.

All buddhas have immeasurable Dharma bodies, free from obstruction, pure, immeasurable, boundless, far removed from the world, unstained by the world, not attached to the world, understanding the true reality of the world, practicing the Dharma that transcends the world, severing the path of language, embracing the realm of non-utterance, free from the aggregates, sense bases, and elements. This is the most supreme and unsurpassed Dharma body adornment of all buddhas.

All buddhas have immeasurable, eternally wonderful light that universally illuminates all worlds in the ten directions, adorned with innumerable wonderful colors, universally illuminating the world without obstruction, giving rise to the treasury of all lights. This is the unsurpassed, most honored adornment of the eternal light of all buddhas.

All buddhas have immeasurable wonderful colors, joyful wonderful colors, pure wonderful colors, wonderful colors that accord with the capacities of all beings, wonderful colors whose light outshines the three realms, and the unsurpassed wonderful colors that reach the other shore. This is the unsurpassed, most honored adornment of the immeasurable wonderful colors of all buddhas.

All buddhas are naturally pure, born in the family of the sacred among the buddhas of the three times, free from all evil, practicing all pure and supreme teachings, giving rise to omniscience, the lineage of the TathÄgata pure and unobstructed - this is the supreme and unsurpassed pure adornment of lineage for all buddhas.

All buddhas are adorned with great kindness and strength. Their bodies are naturally pure, far removed from all unwholesome thoughts and contemplations. Bodily actions are forever still, and those who observe them are never sated. The mind is pure and liberated, and great compassion is complete. All beings are the foremost field of blessings, the unsurpassed recipient. They have compassion for sentient beings and universally establishes them in omniscience, giving rise to the treasury of immeasurable merit and virtue. All beings nurture the treasury of wholesome roots, wisdom, and merit - this is the supreme and unsurpassed pure adornment of the treasury of merit and virtue of great kindness and compassion for all buddhas.
Buddha's disciples!
These are the ten kinds of supreme and unsurpassed adornments of all Buddhas.
Buddha's disciples!
All Buddhas have ten kinds of mastery over the true Dharma.

What are the ten?ğŸ”½All Buddhas have mastery over all dharmas. They can freely use the words and phrases to explain all dharmas without obstruction, which is the mastery of all Buddhas over the true Dharma;

All Buddhas transform in accordance with sentient beings without missing the right time. They teach the Dharma according to their wishes without ever missing the right time, which is the mastery of all Buddhas over the true Dharma;

All buddhas can cause the ten directions to quake in six ways without ever disturbing a single being. In worlds as numerous as the dust motes in the empty space of worlds beyond measure and calculation, they variously adorn them, sometimes lifting them up, sometimes lowering them, sometimes combining them, sometimes scattering them. In each world, in each location, they do not disturb the minds of beings, nor do they cause them to give rise to thoughts of doubt or confusion. This is the autonomous true Dharma of all buddhas.

All buddhas can use wisdom to uphold the various adornments of all worlds. In a single thought, they manifest the various adornments of all worlds. For incalculably incalculable eons, they praise the adornments without exhausting them. They are forever free from the defilements of all worlds and adorn all buddha lands in the world. This is the autonomous true Dharma of all buddhas.

All buddhas, if they see a single sentient being who should receive transformation, will sit cross-legged for incalculably incalculable asaá¹ƒkhyeya eons, their bodies without fatigue or weariness, their minds focused on that person without ever forgetting or neglecting them, not missing the opportune moment, abiding in life for the sake of a single sentient being, exhausting the future eons sitting cross-legged, their bodies without fatigue or weariness, their minds focused on that sentient being without ever forgetting or neglecting them. As with a single sentient being, so it is with all sentient beings. This is the autonomous true Dharma of all buddhas;

All buddhas go to all worlds and to the places of all tathÄgatas without obstruction. In each direction there are world oceans equal to the dharma realm, and in each direction there are immeasurable world nets equal to the dharma realm. In a single thought they are able to go to all world oceans and turn the wonderful Dharma wheel without obstruction. This is the autonomous true Dharma of all buddhas;

All buddhas, in order to tame and transform all sentient beings, in every moment of thought attain perfect enlightenment. They are not enlightened to the true Dharma of the buddhas without first being enlightened. They also do not attain perfect enlightenment while dwelling on the stage of learning. They attain unobstructedness in the Buddha Dharma, do not abandon their autonomous spiritual powers, and with immeasurable wisdom and realm transform sentient beings. This is the autonomous true Dharma of all buddhas.

All buddhas are able to use the eye faculty to perform buddha-work with the ear faculty, are able to use the ear faculty to perform buddha-work with the nose faculty, are able to use the nose faculty to perform buddha-work with the tongue faculty, are able to use the tongue faculty to perform buddha-work with the body faculty, are able to use the body faculty to perform buddha-work with the mind faculty, and are able to use the mind faculty in the various realms of all worlds, worldly realms and supramundane realms. In each and every realm they are able to perform buddha-work. This is the autonomous true Dharma of all buddhas.

All buddhas can place all sentient beings in a single pore, and the body of each sentient being is equal to the buddha lands beyond description, without crowding. Each sentient being lives for immeasurable asaá¹ƒkhyeya kalpas, universally able to travel to immeasurable worlds, seeing buddhas appearing in the worlds and turning the pure Dharma wheel, proclaiming and expounding innumerable Dharma gates, extensively explaining the innumerable dharmas of the past, future, and present, and the activities of all sentient beings in the four modes of deportment without crowding. This is the sovereign right Dharma of all buddhas;

All buddhas are apart from the realm of all characteristics, do not abide in any characteristics, yet are able to discern all characteristics and are not confused about their intrinsic nature. All natures are without intrinsic nature, yet they are able to manifest innumerable pure forms, various adornments, pure buddha lands, and wondrous characteristics. The omniscience of the buddhas is replete with the bright and pure body of wisdom. The lamp of wisdom eliminates the darkness of delusion and is able to manifest to all sentient beings. This is the skillful means of all buddhas.

All buddhas know that the realm of sentient beings is neither past, future, nor present. The dharma realm is also not past, future, or present. The true nature of thusness is free from falsehood, yet they are able to expound the buddhas of the three times and see the equal realm of all buddhas. This is the skillful means of all buddhas.

All buddhas' physical, verbal, and mental actions are uncreated, ultimately non-abiding, free from all conceptual dharmas, and have reached the other shore. They give rise to the treasury of immeasurable merit and virtue, distinguish and expound mundane and supramundane dharmas, and are fully endowed with unobstructed wisdom. They manifest immeasurable sovereign spiritual powers, liberating all beings equal to the Dharma realm. This is the skillful means of all buddhas.

All buddhas know that all dharmas are without knowing and seeing, neither one nor different, neither characterized nor without characteristics, neither adorned nor unadorned. All dharmas are essentially unborn and unceasing. Yet within existent and non-existent dharmas, they do not destroy the characteristics of worldly dharmas. All omniscient ones see and manifest for people the supreme wondrous wisdom, freely expounding all dharmas in detail, yet they do not eternally extinguish the suchness of reality. This is the skillful means of all buddhas.
